Example of how to raycast in the PlayCanvas scene when using WebXR AR.

Tap the shapes to change their color!

result.description: Get started making your own space shooter game by forking this template Asteroids shooter! Aim with your mouse and fire with your left button. Survive as long as you can!

result.description: Example of creating a procedural texture with a gradient effect by LeXXik

result.description: A rainbow trail using the pc.Mesh API

result.description: A sample showing how to place objects in the world without using physics. Click on the ground to place boxes.

result.description: Render 3D objects as part of the UI

result.description: Sample showing how to pick an entity by tag using raycastAll

result.description:
Example project that uses the stencil buffer to create a magic window like effect on a card.

Credit: @ alexanderrdx for the original project

result.description: Dynamically generate normal maps and parallax maps for text

result.description: Sample application with WebXR controller/hand models loaded based on input source profile. Models sourced from: https://github.com/immersive-web/webxr-input-profiles

result.description: Learn how to render world space UI over the top of the world

result.description: Example of how to use DOM (HTML + CSS) with WebXR AR session.

result.name: Loading Draco Compressed GLBs
result.description:
How to load a Draco compressed GLB. 

See https://google.github.io/draco/ for more information on Draco 3D Data Compression.

See https://github.com/CesiumGS/gltf-pipeline for the tool to compress glTF models.

result.description: Example of how to use WebXR Augmented Reality: Plane Detection API. That allows to *actively* track real world surface estimations.

result.description: An example of a radial loading circle

result.description:
An example shows how to focus a camera on target location

Credit: https://playcanvas.com/lexxik

result.description: Example of extending the PlayCanvas engine to create one shot timers. Press P to pause time.

result.description: Sample showing how to control the volume of a sound slot using curve data. Click on the scene to start the audio.

result.description: Sample showing how to load multiple assets at runtime.

result.description: Sample showing how to detect a long press/touch to perform an action.

result.description: Sample showing how to detect a double tap on a touch screen.

Example of creating a planar reflection being used for a transparent mirror/water like surface.
